definitions: To firmly press something, typically with one's fingers or hand, in order to extract liquid or to change its shape.
To manage to get into or through a small or restricted space.
To obtain something, especially money, with difficulty or by force.
To put pressure on someone or something.
examples: She squeezes the juice from the oranges.
The cat squeezes through the narrow gap in the fence.
The company squeezes every last penny from its budget.
The government squeezes the opposition with new policies.
